library(dplyr)
```{r, echo=TRUE}
data <- read.csv(unzip("activity.zip"), header = TRUE)
data <- na.omit(data)
data$date <- as.Date(data$date)
data$interval <- sprintf("%04d", data$interval)
data$interval <- as.POSIXct(strptime(data$interval, "%H%M"))

```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=TRUE}
sum_data <- aggregate(data$steps, by = list(data$date), FUN = sum)
hist(sum_data$x, xlab = "number of steps", main = "Number of steps per day")
mean(sum_data$x)
median(sum_data$x)
```

```{r, echo=TRUE}
avg_activity <- aggregate(data$steps, by = list(data$interval), FUN = mean)
plot(avg_activity$Group.1, avg_activity$x, xlab = "Interval", ylab = "Average number of steps", main = "Average Daily Activity", type = "l")
act_ordered = avg_activity[order(avg_activity$x, decreasing=TRUE),]
head(act_ordered)
```
